channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Government forces Air Canada and flight attendants back to work and into arbitration, after strike strands over 100,000 travelers
item.description: A complete shutdown will impact about 130,000 people a day, and some 25,000 Canadians may be stranded abroad daily. Air Canada operates around 700 fli...

item.title: Trump vowed DC takeover multiple times on 2024 campaign trail: 'He's keeping his promise'
item.description: Trump fulfills campaign promise by federalizing D.C. with 30-day emergency control, cracking down on crime in the nation's capital.

item.title: Mamdani’s socialist, city-run grocery plan faces backlash from Hochul: 'I favor free enterprise'

item.title: Bush family political dynasty may be eyeing a comeback in 2026 governor’s race in Maine

item.title: OpenAI staffers to sell $6 billion in stock to SoftBank, other investors
item.description: The secondary share sale will give OpenAI employees a chance to get cash-rich amid a high-stakes talent war in the AI industry.

item.title: Illinois Is Mandating Mental Health Screenings for Kids. Parents Beware
item.description: This is a profound government overreach.

item.title: Trump’s reciprocal tariffs could be struck down as soon as this month — and the administration is warning of economic apocalypse
item.description: "In short, the economic consequences would be ruinous, instead of unprecedented success."

item.title: Zelenskyy to meet Trump in Washington Monday
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will travel to the White House on Monday to meet with President Trump to discuss a potential peace deal.

item.title: Fixing Elite Universities Means Firing Bad Trustees, Starting with Harvard’s
item.description: Plus, federal arts agencies may be at death’s door, but they’re still making grants.

item.title: Trump’s tax cut could mean a nearly half-trillion-dollar cut to Medicare starting in 2027, CBO warns
item.description: The $3.4 trillion that the tax and spending law adds to the federal deficit over the next decade means that many Medicare programs could see cuts.

item.title: Why Is Trump Imposing Tariffs on Israel?
item.description: Continuing tariffs on Israeli goods exemplifies the overreach of Trump’s policy.

item.title: Trump: Xi Jinping won't invade Taiwan while he's president
item.description: President Trump said he was informed by Chinese President Xi Jinping that the Chinese military won't invade Taiwan during his time in office.

item.title: The ‘No Deal’ Summit and the Path to Peace in Ukraine
item.description: For any American intervention to be successful, before long it will have to involve more stick, as well as carrot.

item.title: Report Exposes How Gender-Extremism Group Pressures Hospitals To Damage Children
item.description: The report explains how the Human Rights Campaign pressures hospitals into child castration to service 'transgender' ideology.

item.title: Airfares are surging again after a months-long slump as carriers trim flights to ease a capacity glut
item.description: The latest consumer price index report showed airfares jumped 4% in July from June, marking the first monthly increase since January.
